dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6800 IH: Internal Revenue Service Processing Returns Instead Of Removing Innocent Taxpayers’ Income Every Season Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Westerman (for himself, Mr. Keller, Mr. Latta, Mr. McKinley, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Burchett, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Good of Virginia, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mr. Hill, and Mr. Gohmert) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To prohibit the Internal Revenue Service from hiring enforcement personnel until processing of certain individual tax returns is completed.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Internal Revenue Service Processing Returns Instead Of Removing Innocent Taxpayers’ Income Every Season Act of 2022 or the IRS PRIORITIES Act of 2022.

section.header: Prohibition on hiring of enforcement personnel

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary’s delegate) may not hire new enforcement personnel until all individual tax returns from tax year 2019 and 2020 are processed.
For purposes of this section, the term enforcement personnel means employees of the Internal Revenue Service who are—

paragraph.text: special agents in the criminal investigation division,
